newsitem.title: INDIA: Reliance unlikely to tap market-official.
newsitem.headline: Reliance unlikely to tap market-official.

text.p: India's largest private firm Reliance Industries Ltd is unlikely to raise funds from the bond market in the near future, Asiamoney quoted the company's treasurer as saying.

"Agarwal says the company is comfortably leveraged and it is highly unlikely that Reliance will come back to the market in the first half of 1997," the February issue of Asiamoney said in an interview with Alok Agarwal.
Asiamoney said two yankee bonds raised by Reliance last year was "a ground-breaking transaction for Indian issuers.
Reliance Industries raised $300 million in three tranches through issues of Yankee bonds in 1996.
